definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)
variant of 構|构[gou4]/(Tw) (coll.) variant of 夠|够[gou4]/to reach by stretching
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication

sentences.english: The journey of the west consists has many characters, mostly mythical creatures.
sentences.chinese: 西游记包括许多章节，大部分虚构的生物。

sentences.english: He attempted to add a great amount of imaginary plots to his story.
sentences.chinese: 他试图以大量虚构的情节为自己的故事添油加醋。

sentences.english: Her story was a pure fiction.
Supposedly, the fabled perfection of art began by mirroring the faultless beauty of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们猜想，艺术虚构的完美是对无暇的自然美的反映。

sentences.english: I thought all this was simply a figment of one's imagination.
sentences.chinese: 我认为那些只不过是人们的凭空想像和虚构。

sentences.english: And you were just a figment of my imagination.
sentences.chinese: 你只是我想像出来的虚构物。

sentences.english: Because these users are fictitious, close this dialog window.
sentences.chinese: 因为这些用户是虚构的，所以关闭该对话框。

sentences.english: In the story,truth was interweaved with fiction.
sentences.chinese: 这篇故事中，真实与虚构交织在一起。

sentences.english: Certainly, it is a casual and fictitious story made up by the microblogger.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这是该微博博主随意虚构出来的故事。

sentences.english: They are placed on both sides of an imaginary vertical line on the page which goes through the middle of the user’s screen.
sentences.chinese: 他们都被放置在用户屏幕中间一条虚构垂直线的两端。

sentences.english: All of Iser's work is grounded in the notion of literature as fiction.
sentences.chinese: 伊瑟尔的所有作品持有文学即虚构的概念。

sentences.english: Construction of fictional views of reality that the populace is coerced into believing.
sentences.chinese: 描写大众被胁迫去相信对现实虚构观点。

sentences.english: Imaginary characters are an important part of Gorillaz performances.
sentences.chinese: 虚构的人物表演的Gorillaz的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: As for the fictional family the Glasses, Mr. Salinger had apparently been writing about them nonstop.
sentences.chinese: 至于虚构的格拉斯一家人，塞林格显然没有停笔。
别将事实与虚构混为一谈。

definition: to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to make sth up/also written 假托[jia3 tuo1]
to pretend/to use a pretext/to make sth up/to pass oneself off as sb else/to make use of
